intro: Guatteria melinii, commonly known as the Mexican guatteria, is a species of flowering plant in the family Lauraceae. It is native to tropical regions of Central America and northern South America. The plant is characterized by its evergreen leaves, which are typically elliptical and have a smooth, waxy surface. It produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in panicles, followed by edible berries that are often consumed by local wildlife. Guatteria melinii thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests.
